page.title: 03Grafham Reservoir.
page.content: The ideas to make{Grafham reservoir} were initiated in 1958, when it became apparent that a number of separate water authorities were intending to abstract water from the Great Ouse to provide for a rapidly expanding population. Much care was taken in selecting the correct site and this particular area was found to be ideal: there already was a natural valley formed by the Diddington Brook because of an impervious layer of chalky boulder clay beneath which stretches a deep and continuous mantle of grey Oxford clay. The preparations were long and careful.Every cottage and barn was removed, every tree felled to ensure that when fishing and water sports were possible, there could be no hidden hazards.
